title: 5 Things To Know: July 7, 2025
content: Five things to know ahead of today's opening bell. President Trump says letters uh to trade partners outlining tariff rates and deadlines uh will begin to be delivered at noon Eastern time today. Treasury Secretary Scott Bason said uh that tariffs, said this yesterday, will revert to the rates announced in April if countries don't make a deal by August 1st. Secretary Bason's going to join us live at 8:00 a.m. Eastern. President Trump's going to meet with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at the White House. Uh today, it comes as the first round of ceasefire talks between Israel and Hamas concluded this morning without a breakthrough. Oracle is offering the US government a 75% discount on its licensed-based software, as well as a substantial discount on its cloud service through the end of November. It's the latest big tech company to cut a deal to reduce prices amid the government's push to cut costs. And Tennessee Republican Congressman Mark Green announced he will resign from Congress effective July 20th. The move will shrink the balance in the house uh to 219 Republicans to 212 Democrats uh at least until his seat is filled. Green said he is returning to the private sector to start his own business. And coming up, President Trump scoring the first major legislative victory of his second term. We're going to talk about what's next on the agenda uh for the administration and we're going to talk about that when we come back.
summary:
The briefing outlines five key developments ahead of the day's opening bell, focusing primarily on US economic policy, international diplomacy, and domestic political shifts. President Trump announced that letters detailing new tariff rates and deadlines would begin delivery at noon Eastern time today to various trade partners, signaling an aggressive stance on trade. This follows Treasury Secretary Scott Bason's statement yesterday, warning that tariffs would revert to April's higher rates if countries fail to finalize trade deals by an August 1st deadline, with Secretary Bason slated for a live interview to discuss these developments further.

In international affairs, President Trump is scheduled to meet with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at the White House today. This high-level meeting occurs against the backdrop of recently concluded ceasefire talks between Israel and Hamas, which ended this morning without achieving a breakthrough, highlighting ongoing tensions in the region.

Domestically, the technology sector is seeing shifts as Oracle has offered the US government significant discounts: a 75% reduction on its licensed-based software and substantial savings on its cloud services, valid until the end of November. This move by Oracle is part of a broader trend where major tech companies are reducing prices, responding to the government's push for cost-cutting measures. Simultaneously, Tennessee Republican Congressman Mark Green announced his resignation from Congress, effective July 20th, to return to the private sector and start his own business. His departure will narrow the Republican majority in the House to 219 Republicans against 212 Democrats, at least until his seat is filled. The briefing concluded by teasing an upcoming discussion on President Trump's administration's agenda, following what is described as his first major legislative victory of his second term.

key_points.text: A preview of five key developments for the day's opening bell.
President Trump scheduled to deliver letters to trade partners.
Letters will outline specific tariff rates.
Letters will also detail tariff deadlines.
Delivery of tariff letters set to begin at noon Eastern time today.
Treasury Secretary Scott Bason's previous statement on tariffs.
Bason stated yesterday that tariffs would revert.
Tariffs would revert to rates announced in April.
This reversion would occur if countries fail to make a trade deal.
The deadline for countries to make a deal is August 1st.
Secretary Bason is slated to appear live at 8:00 a.m. Eastern.
President Trump is scheduled to meet with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
The meeting between Trump and Netanyahu will take place at the White House.
The meeting is happening today.
The first round of ceasefire talks between Israel and Hamas recently concluded.
Ceasefire talks concluded this morning.
The talks between Israel and Hamas ended without a breakthrough.
Oracle is offering a significant discount to the US government.
Oracle's offer includes a 75% discount on licensed-based software.
A substantial discount is also offered on Oracle's cloud service.
These discounts are available through the end of November.
Oracle's deal is part of a trend among big tech companies.
Companies are cutting prices due to government efforts to reduce costs.
Tennessee Republican Congressman Mark Green announced his resignation.
His resignation from Congress is effective July 20th.
Green's departure will alter the balance of power in the House.
The House balance will shift to 219 Republicans and 212 Democrats.
This new balance will remain until Green's seat is filled.
Mark Green plans to return to the private sector.
Green intends to start his own business after resigning.
President Trump has achieved his first major legislative victory of his second term.
There will be an upcoming discussion about the administration's future agenda.
